title: Asian Beef with Baby Bok Choy
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Asian Beef with Baby Bok Choy a try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.86 per serving. One serving contains 336 calories, 25g of protein, and 23g of fat. This recipe is liked by 69 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up soy sauce, baby bok choy, beef broth, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the fresh gingerroot you could follow this main course with the Gingerbread With Fruited Compote as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 93%. This score is amazing. Similar recipes include Asian Beef with Baby Bok Choy, Bok Choy, Shiitake, and Garlic Noodles, and Garlic Ginger Zucchini Noodle Bowl with Salmon and Bok Choy.

winePairing.pairingText: Asian works really well with Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Alsace Willm Cuvee Emile Willm Gewurztraminer with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Cuvee Emile Willm Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: Straw-colored with an aromatic nose both fruit forward (litchi) and floral (rose or violet). In the mouth the attack is supple with notes of mango. A robust wine, fat and powerful. The finish is smooth and silky with notes of roses and spices and the headiness of wallflowers.

instructions: Heat large nonstick skillet on high heat.  Add bok choy, peppers, half the garlic and 1 tsp. ginger; stir-fry 1 min.  Stir in broth; cover.  Simmer 3 to 5 min. or until vegetables are crisp-tender.  Transfer to platter; cover to keep warm.                                            Combine meat, dressing, soy sauce, and remaining garlic and ginger.                                             Heat same skillet on high heat. Add meat mixture; stir-fry 3 to 4 min. or until meat is done. Spoon meat and sauce over vegetables.

steps.step: Heat large nonstick skillet on high heat.
Add bok choy, peppers, half the garlic and 1 tsp. ginger; stir-fry 1 min.  Stir in broth; cover.  Simmer 3 to 5 min. or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Transfer to platter; cover to keep warm.
Combine meat, dressing, soy sauce, and remaining garlic and ginger.
Heat same skillet on high heat.
Add meat mixture; stir-fry 3 to 4 min. or until meat is done. Spoon meat and sauce over vegetables.
